title: Mainly fair weather expected over most parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that mainly fair weather will prevail over most parts of the island.

title: India’s Modi and Trump agree to trade talks to lower tensions
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday that Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi had offered to talk about easing tariffs, buying more U.S. oil, gas and combat aircraft, concessions that may deter a trade war.

title: No daily power cuts from today
byline: The Minister of Power announced that there will be no daily power cuts from today (14 February) as power generated by one unit of the Norochcholai power plant has been added to the national grid.

title: One person killed in accident involving NPP MP’s vehicle
byline: A vehicle belonging to Puttalam District NPP Parliamentarian Mohamed Faisal was involved in an accident in Wennappuwa this morning (14), resulting in the death of one person.

title: SC decision on Local Authorities Elections Bill announced in parliament
byline: The Supreme Court has informed Parliament of its determination on the Local Authorities Elections (Special Provisions) Bill.

title: Judge orders Trump administration to temporarily allow funds for foreign aid to flow again
byline: A federal judge ordered the Trump administration on Thursday to temporarily lift a three-week funding freeze that has shut down U.S. aid and development work worldwide, citing the sweeping damage that the sudden shutdown has done to the nonprofits and other organizations that help carry out U.S. assistance overseas.

title: Ella Rock forest fire set intentionally?
byline: A forest fire that broke out yesterday (13) in the Ella Rock area, near the popular Ella tourist town, has rapidly spread across an area of around 20 acres by this morning, according to reports.

title: US Ambassador visits SLPP Office
byline: US Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Julie Chung, has reportedly visited the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Office this morning (14).

title: CID launches probe into law exam ‘cheating’ allegations against Namal
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has initiated an investigation into allegations that Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa sat for the Sri Lanka Law College examination in an unlawful manner.

title: AG files indictments against Yoshitha and grandmother
byline: The Attorney General has filed indictments in the Colombo High Court against Yoshitha Rajapaksa, the second son of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, and his grandmother Daisy Forrest Wickremesinghe under the Money Laundering Act.

title: Minister regrets recent power cuts, assures future stability
byline: The Ministry of Power and Energy has announced that steps have been taken to end the daily power cuts imposed to manage the electricity demand following the recent island-wide power outage.

title: ‘Saturday Night Live’ plans a massive 50th anniversary special
byline: The 50th anniversary celebration of “Saturday Night Live” is so big, it’s not even on Saturday.

title: TikTok returns on Apple, Google US app stores as Trump delays ban
byline: TikTok returned to the U.S. app stores of Apple and Google on Thursday as President Donald Trump delayed a ban on the Chinese-owned social media app and assured the tech giants they would not be fined for distributing or maintaining it.

title: New Chancellor appointed to Rajarata University
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has appointed Most Ven. Dr. Gallelle Sumanasiri Thera as the Chancellor of the Rajarata University of Sri Lanka.

title: National Sports Council members appointed
byline: Sports Minister Sunil Kumara Gamage today appointed the new National Sports Council, in accordance with the provisions of the Sports Act No. 25 of 1973 with the aim of advising the Minister on matters relating to the promotion, development and governance of sports in Sri Lanka.

title: Pope Francis taken to hospital for bronchitis after struggling to speak
byline: Pope Francis was taken to hospital on Friday with bronchitis and he will skip several planned public events over the next three days, the Vatican said, after the 88-year-old pontiff was seen struggling to speak during one of his meetings in the morning.

title: Foreign Minister to address 8th Indian Ocean Conference in Oman
byline: Sri Lanka’s Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment, and Tourism, Vijitha Herath, is to participate in the 8th Indian Ocean Conference (IOC), scheduled to take place from 16–17 February 2025 in Muscat, Oman.

title: Navin Dissanayake appointed UNP Vice President
byline: Former Minister Navin Dissanayake has been appointed as the Vice President of the United National Party (UNP).

title: Saudi Arabia spearheads Arab scramble for alternative to Trump’s Gaza plan
byline: Saudi Arabia is spearheading urgent Arab efforts to develop a plan for Gaza’s future as a counter to U.S. President Donald Trump’s ambition for a Middle East Riviera cleared of its Palestinian inhabitants, 10 sources said.
